business.headline: IMF's Gita Gopinath on Trump tariffs, impact on global growth, AI and moreDuring the interview, Gita Gopinath discussed the potential impact of US President Donald Trump's plan to impose new trade tariffs, global growth, bilateral trade between India and America, cryptocurrency and more.

IMF's Gita Gopinath suggests India to lower tariffs and focus on domestic reformsGita Gopinath suggested that India should consider lowering its tariffs, not only to counter the tariff concerns raised by former US President Donald Trump, but also to boost its own economic growth.

Sensex crashes as Trump 2.0 spooks D-Street investors. 3 things to knowStock market crash: The Sensex tumbled 1,300 points to 75,773 at around 2:45 pm, while the Nifty50 fell below 23,000. All other broader market indices also collapsed during the trading session.

India could afford to cut back...: IMF's Gita Gopinath on Trump tariff threatGita Gopinath said that India's focus should be on domestic reforms rather than tariff battles as it looks to become a global hub for manufacturing.

Anshuman Mishra shares insights on Donald Trump's second term inaugurationInvestment banker and political strategist Anshuman Mishra provides exclusive insights from Washington DC on Donald Trump's second term inauguration.

Donald Trump's uncertain tariff plan keeps Dalal Street on edge. 3 key takeawaysUS President Donald Trump has decided not to immediately implement tariffs, leading to uncertainty among market investors around the world, including Dalal Street.

Adar Poonawalla shares his views on 70-hour workweek debateCEO of Serum Institute of India, Adar Poonawalla, shared his views on the ongoing debate about the 70-hour workweek, stating that human beings can not be productive after continuously working for 8-9 hours.

Adar Poonawalla on 70-hour workweek: Humans can't be productive beyond 8-9 hoursThe CEO of Serum Institute mentioned that there's no substitute for hard work but the quality of work, and working strategically is of importance.

Explained: Why Paytm share price fell 7% today and what's nextPaytm stock price: The drop in Paytm's share price came after the company reported its Q3FY25 results. Read to find out how brokerages rated Paytm's Q3 results and how the company's stock will perform in future.

Narayana Murthy clarifies 70-hour workweek remark: It's not wrong but is a choiceAfter stirring up a fierce debate on social media, Narayana Murthy has now suggested that the 70-hour workweek is a personal choice and should not be imposed on others.

Sensex tumbles over 800 points. Is Trump 2.0 behind stock market bloodbath?Stock market crash: The S&P BSE Sensex was trading 800.18 points lower at 76,281 at 11:12 am, while the NSE Nifty50 dipped 200 points to 23,144.75.

Explained: Why Zomato shares are down 10% and what investors should doZomato shares were trading 9.42% lower at Rs 218.25 at 10:22 am. Shares of the food delivery giant had also declined in the previous session.

Stallion India IPO: Check allotment status, latest GMP and listing dateStallion India IPO allotment status: Investors who have subscribed to Stallion India IPO can check their allotment status on the online portals of the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) and Bigshare Services Pvt Ltd.

Donald Trump is a dealmaker: WEF President Børge Brende on potential US trade tariffsWorld Economic Forum President Børge Brende said while some tariffs may be introduced by the US administration, Donald Trump's ultimate goal will likely be to negotiate favourable deals.
Want to avoid paying credit card annual fees? Here are 3 easy tipsSometimes banks may waive your annual fees as a goodwill gesture, if you are a loyal customer with a good credit history.

Global elites' wealth grew 3x faster in 2024; 4 new billionaires weekly: OxfamOxfam International, in its latest assessment of global inequality timed to the opening of the World Economic Forum meeting, also predicts at least five trillionaires will crop up over the next decade. A year ago, the group forecast that only one trillionaire would appear during that time.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Bandage on neck, cast on wrist: Saif Ali Khan back home after dischargeSaif Ali Khan was discharged from Mumbai's Lilavati Hospital six days after he was stabbed inside his Bandra home. He was spotted arriving at his residence with a bandage on his neck and a cast on his hand.

66 killed in fire at Turkey ski resort, guests jump out of windowsThe fire broke out at around 3.30 am in the restaurant of the 12-storey Grand Kartal hotel in the resort of Kartalkaya in Bolu province, officials and reports said. The cause of the fire was under investigation.

Why 7,25,000 Indians are shivering in the US. No, it's not the biting coldThere are approximately 14 million undocumented immigrants, including 7,25,000 Indians, in the US. The US had already sent back 1,500 Indians in the financial year 2024 under a lenient Biden administration. With the return of Donald Trump, the thousands of illegal Indian immigrants in the US are on the edge.

Is Trump supplying ammo to expansionist China via Panama Canal?Donald Trump's aggressive stance on the Panama Canal risks setting a dangerous precedent. It could offer China a blueprint to justify its territorial ambitions. Critics say Trump's stance could embolden Beijing's expansionism in Taiwan and the South China Sea, and undermine decades of American preaching of military restraint to China.

Saif attacker's cap found in son Jeh's room, hair under it sent for DNA analysisMohammad Shariful Islam Shehzad allegedly broke into actor Saif Ali Khan's Bandra home on January 16 and stabbed him multiple times. A cap has been found inside the actor's youngest son's room, where the attacker was first spotted.

As the youngest Trump garnered attention after his father's shout-out, people speculated if he would be the inheritor of Trump's political legacy. This is all about Barron Trump, who has a towering presence.

Rash Behari Bose: The forgotten revolutionary who founded Azad Hind FaujThe name Rash Behari Bose might not feel very familiar to us, but this name counts in the list of unsung heroes of India's freedom struggle. The revolutionary from Bengal formed Azad Hind Fauj and imagined a free India for which he gave everything, including settling down in Japan to eliminate the risk of getting caught by the British, which could halt his objective of liberating India.

2024's climate chaos: Why Budget 2025 must prioritise climate actionAs the Indian government led by Prime Minister Narendra Modi enters into a new financial year with Budget 2024-25, the writing on the wall couldn't be any clear - climate change must be a priority. clearer

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.
